name: C
label: Routine C
description: Speed drills, expressive techniques & structured soloing

exercises.name: Alternate Picking Bursts
exercises.description: Endurance exercise: Pick as fast as you can for 20 seconds, rest 10 seconds. Repeat.
exercises.instructions: This is about building speed endurance. Go all-out for 20 seconds, then recover for 10. Repeat for the full 3 minutes.

exercises.name: Pentatonic Sequences
exercises.description: Practice pentatonic scale sequences (groups of 3, 4, etc.)
exercises.instructions: Run through ascending/descending sequences in pentatonic patterns.

exercises.name: Player Licks
exercises.description: Learn licks from: Steve Vai, Joe Satriani, John Mayer, Eric Johnson, SRV, etc.
exercises.instructions: Pick a player and work on one of their signature licks. Focus on the nuances that make it theirs.

exercises.name: Motivic Call and Response
exercises.description: Play a phrase, then respond to it with a complementary phrase
exercises.instructions: Focus on tone and control. Be very deliberate.

exercises.name: Chord Rakes & Ghost Notes
exercises.description: Practice chord rake techniques and ghost note incorporation
exercises.instructions: Focus on dynamics and the percussive quality of the rakes.

exercises.name: Playing Percussively
exercises.description: Use the guitar as a percussive instrument in your playing
exercises.instructions: Muted slaps, taps, and rhythmic techniques combined with melodic content.

exercises.name: Minor Pentatonic Bends & Melodic Restraint
exercises.description: Practice expressive bending within minor pentatonic with restraint
exercises.instructions: Less is more. Focus on making each bend count.

exercises.name: Wide Interval Motifs
exercises.description: Create and practice motifs using wide intervals (5ths, 6ths, octaves+)
exercises.instructions: Practice jumping large intervals cleanly. Build musical phrases around these leaps.

exercises.name: Slow Blues: Long Notes
exercises.description: Play over a slow blues track (70-80 BPM) focusing on long notes only
exercises.instructions: Let notes ring. Focus on tone, vibrato, and letting the spaces breathe.

exercises.name: Fast Rock: Motivic Development
exercises.description: Play over a faster rock track (100+ BPM) focusing on motivic development
exercises.instructions: Start with a simple motif and develop it over the course of the exercise.

exercises.name: One-Take Solo
exercises.description: Play a single solo for the entire 3 minutes. Record if you can.
exercises.instructions: Be mindful of phrasing and cadencing. Create a theme and develop it. The solo should have a clear start, middle, and end. Record if possible to evaluate from a third-person perspective.
